segments.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho vacchagotto paribbājako bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then the wanderer Vacchagotta said to the Buddha:

segments.pli: “ko nu kho, bho gotama, hetu, ko paccayo, yānimāni anekavihitāni diṭṭhigatāni loke uppajjanti—
segments.en: “What is the cause, Master Gotama, what is the reason why these various misconceptions arise in the world? …”

segments.pli: sassato lokoti vā, asassato lokoti vā … pe …
neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇāti vā”ti?
“Saññāya kho, vaccha, aññāṇā, saññāsamudaye aññāṇā, saññānirodhe aññāṇā, saññānirodhagāminiyā paṭipadāya aññāṇā;
segments.en: “Vaccha, it is because of not knowing perception, its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation …”

segments.pli: sassato lokoti vā, asassato lokoti vā … pe …
neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇāti vāti.
Ayaṃ kho, vaccha, hetu, ayaṃ paccayo, yānimāni anekavihitāni diṭṭhigatāni loke uppajjanti—
sassato lokoti vā, asassato lokoti vā … pe …
neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇāti vā”ti.

suttaplex.blurb: The wanderer Vacchagotta asks the Buddha why the various speculative views come to be. The Buddha replies that it is because of not knowing perception.
